comments.body: @deads2k @liggitt this one is nasty. Will try to get rid of this special case as it does not look consistent with the intented semantics of versioning codecs.
what does it even mean to have no Version on a `runtime.Unstructured` object?

Got a list of where?  Not converting if the target is valid seems fine.  Not converting if the existing doesn't have a GVK.... How does that even happen for unstructured?

I can see a followup issue, but it's still weird.
